title: Jennifer Westacott - Wikipedia
snippet: Jennifer Westacott AC is an Australian business executive. She served as the chief executive of the Business Council of Australia (BCA) from 2011 to 2023.

title: Jennifer Westacott: Positions, Relations and Network - MarketScreener
snippet: Jennifer Anne Westacott currently works at Future Generation Global Ltd., as Chairman from 2023, Studio Schools of Australia Ltd., as Chairman from 2019, Western Parkland City Authority, as Chairman from 2019, Wesfarmers Ltd., as Independent Non-Executive Director from 2013, The Pinnacle Foundation, as Director, Cyber Security Research Centre Ltd., as Director from 2018, ATCO Gas Australia Pty Ltd., as Director from 2024, ATCO Australia Pty Ltd., as Director from 2024, Canadian Utilities Ltd., as Independent Director from 2025, The University of New South Wales, as Member from 2019, the University of Western Sydney, as Chancellor from 2023, and Reserve Bank of Australia, as Member-Governors Board.

title: Jennifer Westacott | BoardLinks
snippet: Jennifer Westacott has been Chief Executive of the Business Council of Australia since 2011, bringing extensive policy experience in both the public and private sectors. For over 20 years Jennifer occupied critical leadership positions in the New South Wales and Victorian governments.

title: Jennifer Westacott AC
snippet: Prior to that, she was a board director and lead partner at KPMG, heading its Sustainability, Climate Change and Water practice, and its NSW State Government practice. In July 2024 Jennifer was appointed as a Special Advisor to KPMG. She has extensive experience in critical leadership positions ...

title: Jennifer Westacott AO - Institute of Public Administration Australia (ACT) Limited | Institute of Public Administration Australia (ACT) Limited
snippet: She was the longest serving the Chief Executive Officer of the Business Council of Australia (13 years) and held senior roles in the New South Wales and Victorian governments, focusing on areas such as housing, urban planning, and social policy.
